title: Bug 31627: Core dump on perspective change after adding DBCS project to workspace
description:
Language: Japanese
Build driver: eclipseSDKI20030211linuxgtk
OS: RedHat8 (Japanese: locale jaJP.eucJP), gtk 2.2
JDK Ver.: IBM JDK1.3.1 + SR3
Summary: Core dump occurs when changing perspective after adding a DBCS project to the workspace.

Description:
OB: Upon following the provided steps, the Eclipse IDE crashes, resulting in a core dump.
EB: The Eclipse IDE should not crash or produce a core dump when changing perspectives after adding a DBCS project to the workspace.
SR: Create a project using DBCS characters.
Right-click the project and select 'Team > Share Project...'.
Choose 'Use project name as module name' and click 'Finish'.
Navigate to the Synchronize view and select the project.
Right-click on the project and select 'Add Version Control'.
Right-click on the project and select 'Commit'.
Right-click on the project and select 'Delete' (select 'also delete contents under /workspace folder name').
Change the perspective to CVS perspective.
Right-click on the DBCS project and select 'Check Out As Project'.
